content: fp wear perpendicular felted bag this handbag is a simple pattern with geometric appeal easy to carry and large enough for the essentials and a few treasures it can be made a colorway for every mood or season rating beginner this pattern uses standard us abbreviations materials 1 skein worsted weight wool such as patons classic wool merino 204 m/223 yd main color = mc 25 skein worsted or bulky weight contrast yarn such as bernat felting natural wool contrast color = cc 2 buttons 1 diameter or larger crochet hook us j10/6 0 mm stitch marker yarn needle sewing needle and thread to match button notes the main part of the bag is constructed first as a rectangle and then sewn together before adding the handles in the round leaving a long tail at the beginning of the first section and at the end will allow you to use those tails to stitch up the sides of the bag without needing to join on additional yarn main section using mc chain 68 row 1 double_crochet in 4th chain from hook and in each chain across 66 double_crochet row 2 chain 3 turn counts as first double_crochet throughout pattern double_crochet in each double_crochet across row 3 16 repeat row 2 row 17 repeat row 2 in cc row 18 - 22 switch back to mc and repeat row 2 finish off fold rectangle together so that contrast stripe runs top to bottom whipstitch sides up with the tails of yarn pattern copyright 2008 fp wear this pattern is for personal use only and may not be reproduced or distributed without express permission please contact info@fpwear com with any questions about the pattern or the terms of use fp wear top and handles in mc join yarn with slip_stitch at the side seam round 1 chain 1 single_crochet 88 evenly around slip_stitch to join with first chain place stitch marker moving with each successive round round 2 chain 3 still counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in each single_crochet around 88 double_crochet slip_stitch round 3 in cc chain 3 double_crochet in each double_crochet around 88 double_crochet slip_stitch round 4 in mc chain 1 single_crochet in each double_crochet around 88 single_crochet slip_stitch round 5 chain 2 half_double_crochet in first 15 single_crochet chain 14 skip next 14 single_crochet half_double_crochet in next 30 single_crochet chain 14 skip next 14 single_crochet half_double_crochet in last 15 single_crochet slip_stitch round 6 chain 3 double_crochet in each half_double_crochet and chain around 88 double_crochet slip_stitch rounds 7 - 8 chain 3 double_crochet in each double_crochet around 88 double_crochet slip_stitch round 9 chain 1 single_crochet in each double_crochet around 88 single_crochet slip_stitch finish off weave in ends and felt according to your preferred method being sure to block out the bag while damp sew a button on each side in the gap between the contrast stripes pattern copyright 2008 fp wear this pattern is for personal use only and may not be reproduced or distributed without express permission please contact info@fpwear
